intro: Faroa schaijesiorum, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces fruits that are small, yellow, and somewhat resemble starfruits in appearance. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
